TopicTitle: [1.7.3] Exploration Rover System by A.S.E.T. v0.3 (04.08.19)

Articles.Content:
Sombody knows if this works with 90.0

it does, although it's dependencies do not which means the IVA and wheel are brokem
Hopefully Alexustas is back soon to fix it as i love these they replace the Bobcats Demvs
Most of all the dependencies have a update or a patch update so things work.
I have the latest Firespitter and RPM I think the JSI part tools need an update

I guess that would be:
MODULE
{
    name = JSITransparentPod
    transparentTransforms = CabineGlassBottomLeftSide|CabineGlassBottomRightSide|CabineGlassCentre|CabineGlassLefSide|CabineGlassLeftSide|CabineGlassLowCenter|CabineGlassLowRightSide|CabineGlassRightSide|CabineGlassTop
}

or use MM patch:

@PART[ERSCabine]:Final
{
 -MODULE
 {
  name = JSITransparentPod
 }
}

By the way, the proper way to remove a module using MM is with:

-MODULE[JSITransparentPod] {}

The way you posted it most likely would not do the job right.

I'm trying to run ERS on 0.90 with mixed results. Initially, it looks fine. As you can see in this image, the kerbals can be seen in the cabin and all the assorted cabin parts are there. At some point though, the kerbals and the assorted parts in the cabin disappear while the glass remains transparent, as you can see in this image. I'm not sure what is causing it but according to the error log visible in the latter image, JSITransparent Pod cannot find the ERSInternals part.

However, when I look in the GameData>ASET>ERS>Spaces folder, there's a folder called ERSinternals. Why would JSITransparent Pod fail to find this part? I'm using JSI Part Utilities version 0.2.84.

Any ideas?

Further investigation yields a surprising result. The ERSinternal.cfg file in the ERS internals folder has a extra space between ERSinternal and cfg (i.e., the file name is "ERSinternal_.cfg"). When I removed that space and restarted KSP, the internals and kerbals reappeared! Plus the rover stopped performing its initial weird wheels-locked skid just after go to the runway.

Was that file intentionally renamed with a space to stop it causing some other bug?
How did you get the wheels to install ? I cant edit the setup for them

How did you get the wheels to install ? I cant edit the setup for them

Yeah, I couldn't get the setup menu to appear either. Right clicking on the wheels and cabin would not bring up the proper menus. So I attached the wheels without using the setup, resulting in double suspensions. Here's what it looks like in the SPH. Since the orientation of the wheels on one side were wrong, I had to enable reverse motor/steering on that side to make the rover drive straight.

So far it's working quite nicely. I'm using it for the South Pole challenge and 3 hours in it's still behaving quite nicely.
I think its the part tools that needs updating I sent Mihara a PM but he hasnt answered I guess he is busy with Life

I have the properly firespitter version in each one.

We suspect its the JSI part tools it hasnt been updated once its updated I am hoping everything will work
This stuff looks great. Any plans for some smaller single-seaters?

I've got a temporary fix for the JSI Part Utilities put together. You can test it at

https://www.dropbox.com/s/dhwtxhpaaw0mo1k/JSIPartUtilities.dll?dl=0

I'll be submitting a pull request to Mihara in the next couple of days, so please let me know if this fixes it. Just replace the existing DLL.
The fix is working i can toggle the suspension and bring up the nodes and attach the wheels correctly it drives and performs as well as it ever has thankyou MR Artwhaley
Yeah, it's working for me too, thanks man!
Oh dude, It works perfectly. Thank you so much.

I haven't tested yet, but the excited remarks so far have me convinced. You've succeeded where I failed at fixing the plugin. Of course, I failed because I didn't actually fix anything... maybe i should actually try to fix it next time.

Soooo...how do y'all land this on the another celestial body AND drive it? I managed to put it on Mun, but once there, it behaves oddly. Forward key just sends the ERS in a spin, but left and right work just fine.

Odd little beast.

Hmmm...with having to fix how the wheels are attached on opposite sides, you may still have to manually toggle the direction of wheel spin in the right-click menu?... (ie one side is rotating forward, while the other side is rotating backward?)

Alright so I tried it out and at first I had the same problem with the double suspension. Then I tried it with the fixed DLL but now the little snap dots on the lower part of the rover where the wheels should be attached are gone. Can someone help me with that problem? I think I have downloaded everything the mod needs, just not the SATscan
Once you have the updated dll you have to right click the rover base part and tell it to show the nodes. If that doesn't do it... well... hopefully someone smarter will answer.
